title: Inside US raid on Hyundai plant - Korean workers hid in air ducts, plunged into pond
content: A massive immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia led to the arrest of 475 workers, predominantly Korean nationals, triggering diplomatic intervention from South Korea. Federal agents executed the operation following a months-long investigation into unlawful employment practices. The raid involved multiple agencies, highlighting a crackdown on workforce exploitation and federal law violations, as stated by Homeland Security.

title: 'Lost lives cannot return': Ukraine PM after Russia's largest drone strike
content: Russia launched its largest aerial assault on Kyiv since the war began, resulting in casualties and damage to a key government building. Ukraine retaliated by targeting Russia's Druzhba oil pipeline. Amidst stalled peace talks, international calls for tougher sanctions against Russia are intensifying, with President Zelenskyy expressing willingness to meet President Putin.

title: UP’s ‘fake IAS’ flaunted photos with CMs, governors; lived VIP life with Range Rover
content: Saurabh Tripathi, masquerading as an IAS officer, was arrested after a businessman grew suspicious of his claims. Tripathi used social media and forged documents to create a false persona, even acquiring luxury vehicles with fake government plates. Investigations are underway across multiple states to uncover the full extent of his deception and identify victims who were promised official favors.

title: India men's compound archery team wins first-ever gold at World Archery Championships
content: India's men's compound archery team made history by clinching their first-ever gold at the World Archery Championships, defeating France. The team comprised Aman Saini, Rishabh Yadav, and Prathamesh Bhalchandra Fuge. Rishabh Yadav also secured a silver medal with Jyothi Surekha Vennam in the compound mixed team event, losing to the Netherlands in the final after a successful run.

title: Ajit Agarkar: Taking bullets with a smile in Indian cricket’s hottest seat
content: Ajit Agarkar’s stint as India’s chief selector has been defined by bold calls, grooming young talent, and delivering results — including two ICC titles. Former selector Devang Gandhi told TOI that selection is “more elimination than choice,” stressing communication, long-term vision, and alignment with the captain as keys to balancing criticism and building for the future.

title: Musk’s 3-word reply: Responds to German migrants’ Sharia law claim; sparks debate
content: Elon Musk ignited online controversy by responding to a viral video of migrants in Germany who claimed they would replace German laws with Sharia law once they become the majority, with Musk simply stating, "I believe him.

title: Woman killed for rejecting arranged marriage
content: In a tragic incident in New Delhi, a 20-year-old woman was strangled to death by her father, Gayyur, for resisting an arranged marriage. Gayyur, 48, confessed to the crime and surrendered to the police. The young woman's desire to marry someone of her choice was met with opposition from her parents, leading to the fatal confrontation.

title: Married woman, teen lover murder 6-year-old who saw them in 'compromising position'
content: In a shocking incident in Sikandra Rau, a six-year-old girl, Urvi, was murdered after she discovered a woman and a teenage boy in a compromising situation. Fearing Urvi would reveal their secret, the pair strangled her and disposed of her body in a well. The woman has been arrested, and the boy detained, with police investigations ongoing.

title: Kolkata horror: 20-yr-old 'abducted', gang-raped by 2 friends
content: In Haridevpur, Kolkata, a 20-year-old woman was allegedly abducted from her residence by two friends, Chandan Mallick and Debangshu Biswas, after refusing a birthday party invitation. The accused then took her to Malancha, where she was reportedly raped multiple times.

title: AI godfather warns: Hinton on AI’s ‘nuclear’ threat; 'can help create bioweapons'
content: Geoffrey Hinton, a prominent AI figure, expresses serious concerns about AI's potential dangers, shifting from promoting its development to warning about its threats. He envisions AI empowering individuals to create bioweapons, akin to nuclear threats, and surpassing human emotional capabilities. While Hinton believes AI possesses genuine intelligence, his former colleague Yann LeCun holds a contrasting view on its limitations.

title: 'Crap note': Trump aide Navarro reacts to X flagging his post as 'hypocrisy'; slams India again
content: Former White House advisor Peter Navarro has accused India of profiteering from Russian oil purchases, alleging that India didn't buy any before the Ukraine invasion and is now fueling Russia's war efforts. These remarks have been strongly refuted by India's Ministry of External Affairs, which dismissed them as inaccurate and misleading.

title: Russia hits Kyiv with drones, missiles killing 2; Ukraine attacks Bryansk oil pipeline
content: A mass Russian drone and missile strike on Kyiv resulted in at least two fatalities, including a one-year-old child, and multiple injuries, with smoke seen near the Cabinet of Ministers building. This marks the second major attack on Kyiv in recent weeks, escalating concerns. Simultaneously, Ukraine targeted the Druzhba oil pipeline in Russia's Bryansk region, causing significant damage.

title: Japan PM Ishiba to resign to avoid party split - Report
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba resigned amidst mounting pressure from the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) following a significant setback in the upper house elections. The LDP-Komeito coalition lost its majority due to public discontent and US tariffs. Ishiba's decision aims to prevent a party split as calls for an early leadership election intensified.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
content: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: Rajasthan: Army uses drone to rescue man trapped in Ayad River - watch
content: The Indian Army's Battle Axe Division showcased remarkable ingenuity by rescuing a 30-year-old man stranded in Udaipur's Ayad River. Utilizing drones for remote coordination, the Army ensured a safe evacuation amidst the river's dangerous surge. Shared by Konark Corps, the rescue highlights the force's embrace of technology for rapid response in emergencies.

title: Exclusive: Jason Holder calls for 'fair compensation' to counter lure of T20 leagues
content: Jason Holder, despite not playing Test cricket for over a year, expresses his unwavering desire to return to the West Indies Test team, emphasizing his passion for international cricket and the significance of Test cricket as the pinnacle of the sport.

title: Jharkhand: Hardcore Naxalite carrying Rs 10L bounty killed in Chaibasa
content: In a significant operation, security forces neutralized a key naxalite leader, Amit Hansda, in an encounter in Jharkhand's Chaibasa on Sunday. Hansda, a Zonal Commander, had a reward of Rs 10 lakh on his head. The joint operation by the COBRA battalion and district police also led to the recovery of weapons, including an SLR rifle.

title: Former Junior No. 1 Sankar Subramanian stays grounded as India seek badminton revival
content: Indian badminton faces a period of underwhelming performances, but Sankar Subramanian, a former junior World No. 1, expresses optimism about the future. Despite recent setbacks, he believes the next generation holds immense potential. Sankar emphasizes the need for improved grassroots programs, high-performance training, and comprehensive support systems to consistently compete at the highest level and regain India's dominance in badminton.

title: Gurgaon: ‘Cremated’ man walks home a day later
content: Gurgaon police were left baffled after Poojan Prasad, presumed dead and cremated by his son, returned home a day later. Police had identified a mutilated body as Prasad based on a missing person report and family claims. The cremation took place before Prasad's brother-in-law spotted him alive.

title: 'Let's go!': Sunil Chhetri on Virat Kohli's fitness: drops a massive hint
content: Sunil Chhetri, former India football captain, has revealed details about Virat Kohli's fitness. Kohli shared his fitness test scores with Chhetri. Chhetri compared Kohli's dedication to Cristiano Ronaldo. He highlighted their relentless pursuit of excellence. Chhetri emphasized the importance of focusing on the present. He also noted how Kohli and Ronaldo consistently strive for improvement. Their commitment is truly remarkable.

title: Who is Hisahito? Japan’s dragonfly-loving prince; first male royal adult in 40 yrs
content: Prince Hisahito's formal recognition as an adult in Japan marks a significant moment, being the first male royal to reach adulthood in four decades. This event sparks both celebration and concern due to the dwindling number of male heirs in the Imperial Family.

title: UP woman uploads distress clip online; police trace IP, rescue her in 20 mins
content: Noida police swiftly responded to a distressing video posted on social media by a woman threatening suicide, alleging her husband and others had ruined her life. Using the IP address, officers located her in Sector 28 within 20 minutes, intervening to prevent her from harming herself.

title: 9-year-old’s body found in pond in West Bengal, mob lynch neighbours on suspicion
content: A nine-year-old's death in Tehatta, Nadia district, triggered a violent mob lynching. Swarnabha Mondal, missing since Friday, was found dead in a pond. Locals, suspecting Utpal and Soma Biswas due to a family feud, attacked their home, resulting in their deaths. Police inaction is alleged, with locals claiming quicker response could have prevented the tragedies. An investigation is underway.

title: ‘Bidis and Bihar’ X post costs VT Balram his media head post
content: The Kerala Congress unit faced backlash after an X post drew parallels between 'bidis and Bihar,' leading to accusations of defaming the people of Bihar. V T Balram stepped down as head of the party's digital media cell following the controversy.

title: Why Elon Musk and India critic Peter Navarro detest each other
content: The clash over Community Notes is only the latest chapter in a bitter personal feud. Earlier this year, Navarro derided Musk as “a car assembler” whose supply chains depended on China. Musk retaliated with some of his harshest language yet, calling Navarro “dumber than a sack of bricks” and “truly a moron,” even mocking his Harvard PhD as “a bad thing.” He joked that Navarro should consult “Ron Vara” — the fictional expert Navarro once invented to bolster his anti-China arguments.

title: Trump tariffs on software exports? Indian IT sector worried - fears twin blows
content: The potential imposition of US tariffs on software exports is causing apprehension in India's IT sector, which relies heavily on the US market. Experts warn this could lead to dual taxation and increased operational costs, exacerbating existing challenges from economic uncertainty and automation.

title: Terror strikes cricket ground in Pakistan: Explosion kills 1; several injured
content: A deadly explosion struck a cricket match in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, resulting in one fatality and multiple injuries. Police confirmed the attack in Bajaur district was targeted, utilizing an IED. The incident follows recent violent encounters in the province, highlighting ongoing security challenges as forces combat militant activities.

title: Rajasthan: 20 deaths in police lock-up in 2 years; govt report indicates a pattern
content: A Rajasthan government report reveals 20 custodial deaths in police lock-ups between August 2023 and August 2025, attributed to health issues, suicides, and one disputed case. Despite recurring patterns and procedural lapses, investigations have largely cleared police personnel, resulting in minor disciplinary actions. The Supreme Court is now examining compliance with CCTV mandates amid concerns over custodial deaths.

title: How a UP cop’s Instagram post reunited mother, son after 10 years; his 5th such case
content: Head constable Ashwani Malik, an influencer cop in UP, utilized his social media presence to reunite a 77-year-old woman with her son, who had been missing for over a decade. Malik found the disoriented man, Mohd Salim, and posted a video that was recognized by Salim's nephew in Mumbai.

title: She escaped Russia-Ukraine war, only to be killed in US: Woman stabbed by ex-con
content: Iryna Zarutska, a 23-year-old Ukrainian refugee, was fatally stabbed on a Charlotte light rail train in a random attack. Surveillance video shows Decarlos Brown Jr., a homeless ex-convict, attacking Zarutska without provocation. Brown has been charged with first-degree murder, raising concerns about transit safety and prompting increased security measures.

title: Jameson Williams gets $83M Lions deal: extension sealed; eyes 2025 offensive stardom
content: Jameson Williams, Detroit's explosive wide receiver, has secured a three-year extension worth up to $83 million. This deal, finalized just before the Lions' season opener, underscores Detroit's commitment to its offensive core. Following a breakout 2024 season, the Lions are banking on Williams' evolving skill set to complement Amon-Ra St. Brown, while contract talks with Aidan Hutchinson are ongoing.

title: Chhattisgarh: 8-yr-old girl forced to do 100 squats in class, left unable to walk
content: In Chhattisgarh's Surguja district, an eight-year-old girl is unable to walk after allegedly being forced to do 100 sit-ups and beaten by her teacher for using the toilet. The incident at a government-funded school led to muscle damage in her legs. Authorities have ordered an inquiry, and the school officials have been placed on leave.

title: 'This may be most important job': Is Vance giving a hint about 2028 presidential run?
content: Vice President JD Vance is focused on his current role, deflecting questions about a potential 2028 presidential run. He emphasized the importance of performing well in his current position, suggesting that future political opportunities will arise naturally. Vance lauded Trump's tireless work ethic and his trust in his team, highlighting the collaborative nature of their partnership.

title: First time in international cricket: Both openers dismissed in first two balls - How?
content: In a Cricket World Cup League 2 match, Scotland defeated Canada. Scotland won the toss and chose to bowl. Canada's openers created an unwanted record by getting out on the first two balls. Brad Currie took five wickets. Shreyas Movva scored 60 runs, helping Canada reach 184. George Munsey's unbeaten 84 and Richie Berrington's 64 guided Scotland to victory.

title: Delhi riots: Sharjeel Imam moves Supreme Court against HC’s bail denial
content: Activist Sharjeel Imam has appealed to the Supreme Court against the Delhi High Court's denial of bail in a case related to the 2020 Delhi riots and anti-terror law. The High Court had rejected bail to several individuals, including Umar Khalid, emphasizing that protests cannot be a guise for conspiratorial violence.

title: 'It’s pretty simple': Bill Belichick’s blunt UNC ban verdict; shockwaves in college-NFL scouting
content: Bill Belichick ignited a controversy by responding to UNC's decision to ban Patriots scouts. Belichick retaliated, barring UNC representatives from New England's facilities, emphasizing respect and fairness in college-NFL relations. His blunt statement resonated, highlighting the potential impact on scouting ties and turning a local issue into a national discussion about access and reciprocity.

title: Starlink India push: Musk’s firm in talks with data centres, telcos; groundwork begins
content: Starlink is actively establishing its terrestrial infrastructure in India, engaging in advanced discussions with data center operators, internet exchange providers, and telecom companies. Having secured necessary clearances and trial bandwidth, Starlink is finalizing ground station locations to connect its satellite network. These strategic tie-ups aim to support large-scale satellite connectivity, positioning Starlink to compete in India's growing satcom market.

title: Ronaldo already 40? No problem! His volley in World Cup qualifiers stuns fans – Watch
content: Cristiano Ronaldo, at 40, showed his brilliance. He scored twice as Portugal defeated Armenia 5-0 in a World Cup qualifier. Ronaldo's goals increased his international record to 140. Joao Felix and Joao Cancelo also scored. Ronaldo aims for a sixth World Cup appearance. He is determined to win the trophy in 2026. The victory highlights Portugal's strong start.

title: 11-year-old delivers premature baby after repeated rape in Bareilly
content: In Uttar Pradesh, an 11-year-old girl gave birth to a premature baby that tragically died shortly after delivery. Police have arrested Rashid, a 31-year-old man, accused of repeatedly raping and blackmailing her. The pregnancy was discovered when the girl complained of stomach pain, leading to an ultrasound revealing her condition.

title: Narrow escape for MP Rashid as Tihar inmates attack him
content: Engineer Rashid, a Baramulla MP, was reportedly attacked in Tihar Jail by transgender inmates following an altercation, sustaining minor injuries. His party, AIP, alleges a deliberate attempt to harm him and claims Kashmiri prisoners are being intentionally housed with transgender individuals who are encouraged to provoke them.

title: Third wife, lover & aide bludgeon man, dump body in well; second wife raises alarm
content: In Anuppur district, a shocking crime unfolded as Bhaiyalal Rajak was murdered by his third wife, Munni, and her lover, Narayan Das Kushwaha. The couple, along with an accomplice, bludgeoned Bhaiyalal to death with an iron rod before disposing of his body in a well.

title: Record! Raza surpasses Virat Kohli to achieve rare milestone
content: Sikandar Raza surpassed Virat Kohli's record for the most Player of the Match awards in T20Is, achieving his 17th during Zimbabwe's victory against Sri Lanka. Raza's impressive performance, including 3 wickets for 11 runs, helped restrict Sri Lanka to a mere 80 runs. This accomplishment places him ahead of Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav among full-member nations.

title: NIRF 2025 ranking flaw: BHU dental college listed twice
content: NIRF 2025 rankings are under scrutiny as Banaras Hindu University's Faculty of Dental Sciences appears twice in the dental category, securing 15th and 18th positions. This anomaly, stemming from separate submissions, raises concerns about data accuracy and verification within the ranking system. Conflicting data on placements further underscores the need for a methodology review to maintain credibility.

title: Kate and William split loyalties: Rival rugby outings; clash at Women’s World Cup
content: In a display of their ongoing rugby rivalry, Kate Middleton and Prince William attended separate Women's Rugby World Cup matches on September 6, 2025. Princess Kate, patron of the Rugby Football Union, cheered for England against Australia in East Sussex. Meanwhile, Prince William, patron of the Welsh Rugby Union, supported Wales in their match against Fiji in Exeter.

title: Karnataka 'voter fraud' issue: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge accuses EC of stonewalling crucial information
content: Mallikarjun Kharge shared a media report that claimed that the case related to an attempt to remove electors by forging Form 7, ahead of the Karnataka Assembly election in 2023, has gone cold since the ECI is yet to share crucial data

title: Chhattisgarh Minister Kedar Kashyap accused of assaulting guest house employee
content: The incident has sparked a sharp reaction from the Opposition Congress party that has sought a public apology from the BJP for one of its Ministers assaulting an employee

title: TRAI rejected application to send SMS with documentary link on Maharashtra 'poll fraud': Congress
content: The Opposition party also claimed that these were "telltale signs of guilt of Maharashtra election fraud" and there were coordinated moves by various arms of the government to suppress information

title: Rajasthan witnessed 20 custodial deaths in two years: Government report
content: The report, which was submitted in the state assembly in response to a query by Congress MLA Rafeek Khan, said 12 of the deaths were linked to health issues, including six from heart attack.

title: NLCIL mines get five-star rating of Union Coal Ministry
content: The Lignite Mine 1A in Neyveli, Talabira II and III coal mines in Odisha and Barsingar lignite mine in Rajasthan have got the first place in the survey of lignite and coal-based open cast mines

title: One dead, five injured after Ganpati immersion electrocution in Mumbai’s Saki Naka
content: The mishap took place at around 10:45 a.m. when a hanging electric wire came in contact with the Ganpati idol during the immersion procession

title: Jamiat denies Madani’s remarks on dialogue with RSS over Mathura, Gyanvapi mosques
content: Organisation clarifies that its president was misquoted; says legal authorities will decide on disputes

title: FPIs withdraw ₹12,257 cr in first week of September on strong dollar, U.S. tariff concerns
content: The total outflow by Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) in equities reached ₹1.43 lakh crore so far in 2025, data with the depositories showed

title: Two militants, two cybercriminals arrested in Manipur
content: “An insurgent belonging to the banned PREPAK outfit was nabbed from his residence in Haoreibi area in Imphal West district,” a police statement said

title: India rains LIVE: Yamuna continues to flow above danger mark; cloudburst hits Naugaon area in Uttarkashi
content: When the cloudburst occurred in Uttarkashi, several people had already vacated their homes, anticipating danger due to heavy rains in the area

title: A.P. Minister Srinivas explores global partnerships at SME Summit in Davos
content: Kondapalli Srinivas engages with global leaders from innovation, finance, and technology sectors, with a focus on building resilient ecosystems for SMEs

title: Target set to provide 50,000 jobs overseas in next five years: Lokesh
content: A skill portal will be launched this month to integrate training and job opportunities, says the HRD Minister

title: Meet farmers’ fertilizer needs fully, CM tells officials
content: Fertilizer supply should be linked with Aadhaar-based WebLand and e-Crop systems from the coming rabi season, he says

title: Cloudburst hits Naugaon area in Uttarkashi; no loss of life so far
content: The cloudburst occurred at Syori Phal Patti in Yamuna Valley in the evening, and sludge from a flooded stream rushed downwards, inflicting damage in low-lying areas

title: Umar Khalid | Activist behind bars
content: The former JNU student has been languishing in jail without trial and bail since 2020 for his alleged involvement in Delhi riots, a charge he denies vehemently

title: Caste census: Clamour emerges over how sub castes are classified
content: The listing of sub-castes in alphabetical order, rather than under each caste as one category, has riled many communities

title: Britain's Crown Prosecution Service inspects Tihar jail as India intensifies efforts to extradite fugitives
content: According to information, the CPS team visited the high-security ward of Tihar and spoke with the prisoners there

title: Five persons booked for running mobile sex determination test unit in Tirupattur
content: All of them were booked under Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act, 1971, by Kurusilapattu police in Tirupattur.

title: Youth held for selling painkiller tablets in Vellore
content: Investigations revealed the suspect Vishwa was selling the tablets for youth and students in the area.

title: Forest department initiates probe into fire in reserve forest atop Arunachala Hills
content: More than one acre of forest land was gutted in the incident. The hills are home to spotted deer, sloth bear, peacocks, monkeys and Indian gaur.

title: Arts and Science college in Vaniyambadi holds Graduation day
content: The executive director of VIT highlighted the importance of women’s empowerment and cited women achievers as examples

title: WBSSC to hold examination for teachers recruitment on September 7 amidst high security
content: About 3.19 lakh candidates will take the exam tomorrow for appointment as teachers for class IX and class X in state-run schools. The recruitment on the last occasion in 2016 was riddled with irregularities and corruption

title: Haryana government transfers 20 IAS officers, 1 HCS officer in major reshuffle
content: Munish Sharma, Deputy Commissioner, Charkhi Dadri, has been transferred and posted as Secretary, Haryana Board of School Education, Bhiwani, relieving Munish Nagpal of the charge

title: Is a shift underway in India’s foreign policy? | Explained
content: How productive was the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit? Did a meeting between China, Russia and India at Tianjin signal a change in relations? Did U.S. moves on tariffs and sanctions prompt this? What are the leaders saying?

title: Mumbai bids grand farewell to ‘Ganpati Bappa’ amid rains, bomb threat; over 18,000 idols immersed
content: According to the BMC, 18,186 Ganapati idols, 1,058 of ‘sarvajanik mandals’ (local community groups) and 258 of Goddess idols, were immersed in natural water bodies and artificial ponds created by the civic body till 9 p.m.

title: Rajendra Arlekar | Saffron guard
content: The Kerala Governor, a former functionary of the BJP, faces criticism for ‘saffronising’ education and violating constitutional propriety

title: BCCI adds ₹14,627 crore in five years, ₹4,193 crore in last financial year: Report
content: Aided by IPL earnings and ICC distributions, the BCCI posted a surplus of ₹1,623.08 crore for 2023-24, up from ₹1,167.99 crore in the previous year, according to the report

title: T.N. Health Minister flags air travelers’ woes, seeks Airbus services on key routes
content: Mr.Subramanian highlighted that, in recent times, passengers flying to Madurai from Chennai airport have been experiencing severe mental stress due to inadequate seating in shuttle buses

title: Opposition parties criticise DMK government for deterioration of law and order situation in T.N.
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami says the Chief Minister M.K. Stalin-led government has failed to maintain law and order and DMK functionaries being involved in criminal activities has become a regular occurrence

title: Tamil Nadu government introduces overseas scholarship for Muslim students
content: The scholarship will assist their higher studies if they are admitted to institutions ranked within the top 250 in the Global QS rankings

title: PM Modi Seated In Last Row At Workshop As BJP Gears Up For Veep Polls: Sources
content: The BJP is gearing up for the Vice Presidential elections by holding a two-day work workshop with all its Members of Parliament participating in the event.

title: Guest House Staff Says Chhattisgarh Minister Thrashed Him, He Denies Charge
content: The contractual employee of a government guest house in Chhattisgarh's Bastar alleged that Kedar Kashyap assaulted and abused him, claiming he did not unlock guest rooms in the facility.

title: Japan PM Shigeru Ishiba To Resign To Avoid Split In Ruling Party: Report
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has decided to resign to avoid a split within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party.

title: Bengali Must On Signboards In Kolkata: Civic Body's Big Language Move
content: The Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) has issued a directive mandating that all business establishments, commercial institutions, and shops across the city must display signboards prominently in Bengali.

title: Will Fight Those Against Dasara Invite To Banu Mushtaq Legally: Siddaramaiah
content: Those opposing International Booker Prize winner Banu Mushtaq inaugurating this year's 'Mysuru Dasara' will be fought both politically and legally, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has said.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Luxury Cars, Villa, And A Dubai Link To 2,500-Crore Drug Racket
content: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has issued an international Silver Notice against a Dubai-based drug trafficker accused of orchestrating one of the country's biggest cocaine seizures, in what officials are calling a landmark step.

title: Why Ordering Food On Swiggy, Zomato May Get Costlier This Festive Season
content: The hike in platform fees by Zomato, Swiggy and magicpin ahead of the festive season is set to make ordering food costlier for millions of users across the country.

title: RFK Jr's Family Members Say He Is "Threat" To Americans' Health, Call For His Resignation
content: Members of Robert F Kennedy Jr's family are calling for him to step down as health secretary following a contentious congressional hearing this past week.

title: Meta Hiring US-Based Contractors To Build Hindi AI Chatbots: Report
content: These roles are part of Meta's larger plan to expand its AI presence in fast-growing markets such as India, the report said.

title: Sonu Sood Meets Abhijot Singh, Boy With Kidney Disorder, After NDTV Campaign
content: Bollywood actor Sonu Sood on Sunday met in Punjab an eight-year-old boy with a kidney ailment, whom he and Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann have promised to help financially after an NDTV campaign.

title: BJP's Big Allegation As Bengal Conducts Teachers' Exam After 9 Years
content: The exam for recruiting teachers for classes 9 and 10 is being held today and on September 14 for classes 11 and 12, after a gap of nine years.

title: Sunscreen Scandal And A Debate Over SPF Claims In Skin Cancer Hotspot
content: For Australians, applying sunscreen is a daily habit. But how safe is it? Former cricket captain Michael Clarke, recently treated for skin cancer on his nose, knows the stakes all too well.

title: PM Modi To Visit Flood-Hit Punjab On Tuesday To Review Relief Measures
content: Punjab is facing one of its worst floods in decades, with the Sutlej, Beas, and Ravi and several seasonal rivulets in spate due to heavy rain across north India.

title: Smoke Seen Rising From Ukraine's Cabinet Building After Russian Strikes
content: Russian strikes across Ukraine overnight killed at least four people and wounded dozens more, authorities announced, as officials said a government building in the capital Kyiv was on fire after the attack.

title: India-US Probe On $150 Million Drug Racket Gets Global Terror Watchdog's Praise
content: The FATF referred to the case against two brothers from Uttarakhand's Haldwani, Banmeet Singh and Parvinder Singh, who ran a 'Singh drug trafficking organisation' on the darknet.

title: "Hazratbal Shrine Symbol Of Peace": Kiren Rijiju On Vandalism Over Ashoka Emblem
content: A viral video showed a mob defacing the national emblem on a marble plaque at the shrine, citing that sculpting figures goes against Islamic ethos.

title: Bengal Shocker: Trinamool MLA Threatens To Pour Acid In BJP Leader's Mouth
content: A few years ago, he had threatened to cut off the hands and feet of leaders and workers of the BJP, CPI(M) and Congress. Now, Malda district Trinamool Congress (TMC) President Abdur Rahim Bakshi has threatened to pour acid into the mouth of a BJP MLA

title: What's Happening In South America And Why US Is Sending Warships There
content: The United States is continuing to boost its military forces near Venezuela to combat threats from Latin American drug cartels -- even after a US strike destroyed what President Donald Trump said was a drug-carrying boat.

title: J&K parties seek removal of Waqf chairperson Darakshan Andrabi over ‘National Emblem plaque’ row
content: Chairperson placing a plaque with the National Emblem at the shrine sparks protests; BJP, Shiv Sena demand action against those who vandalised plaque

title: Science-based problem-solving should take an inclusive approach, says academic
content: Given the lack of adequate scientists and doctors across the globe, he points out that the role of community health workers was paramount and their access to right set of tools critical

title: Dinner gatherings at PM, BJP chief’s residences cancelled over floods in Punjab and other regions
content: While Friday brought some respite from the relentless rain, several northern Indian States grapple with the destruction left behind by the monsoon in the most affected areas

title: Supreme Court panel on students’ mental health gets State Nodal Officers; over 1 lakh survey responses received
content: The 12-member National Task Force was formed after parents of students who had died by suicide in higher education campuses had sought relief from the Supreme Court

title: Declining budget for MGNREGS means reduced income for women in rural India, say activists
content: Given the Finance Ministry’s directive capping the expenditure in the first two quarters at 60% of the total available budget, the Centre has only ₹79 crore under the programme for the month of September

title: Duty to Constitution lies with every lawyer, not just people in power corridors, says Justice Nagarathna
content: In a convocation address, the senior apex court judge exhorted law graduates to use their knowledge and skills to build inclusive institutions and promote systemic equity, becoming ‘true custodians of the rule of law’

title: Process has become punishment in criminal justice delivery: ex-CJI N.V. Ramana
content: At Lexposium 2025, organised by the SRM School of Law in association with The Hindu, the retired judge listed several factors that erode public trust on the judiciary, including pendency of cases and high costs of litigation

title: Police officers involved in Kunnamkulam custodial torture suspended
content: Police surveillance camera footage of the torture, procured through an uphill RTI litigation by the victim, a Youth Congress leader, had led to public outrage. Congress workers march to the residences of the suspended officers

title: Probe on voter fraud in Karnataka hits roadblock as Election Commission of India yet to share technical data
content: The Karnataka CID has been probing a systematic attempt to remove names of 5,994 voters from electoral rolls by forging Form 7, in the Aland Assembly constituency in Kalaburagi district, ahead of the 2023 Assembly election; many electors whose names were sought to be deleted and those whose credentials were misused to make the applications had filed complaints with the Aland Tehsildar

title: Sky-walk glass bridge another jewel in Visakhapatnam’s crown
content: Slated for inauguration soon, the bridge, touted to be the longest in the country, offers tourists a breathtaking view of the Bay of Bengal on the one side and the city on the other

title: Malayalis give kitchens a break with takeaway Onasadya
content: It was after COVID-19 that Malayalees began relying on caterers for their ‘Onasadya’. The trend soon gained popularity as families recognised its other benefits

title: Election Commission of India to hold State CEOs meeting on September 10 over SIR
content: All CEOs would be making presentations on September 10 regarding the number of voters in their States and U.T.s and details of the last intensive revision, the official said

title: Congress wants to contest more seats in Bihar after the success of Rahul Gandhi’s Voter Adhikar Yatra
content: Seat distribution in the Opposition mahagathbandhan alliance may be finalised and announced ‘sometime in the second half of September’, sources in the RJD said

title: Kerala to usher in foreign tourist season with a mixed bag of hopes
content: Rise of Sri Lankan tourism has been posing a big challenge to Kerala as the holistic treatment offered by the State at a rate of $150 is now offered for $100 by Sri Lanka

title: Super-speciality hospital in Hassan will be ready in eight months: Karnataka Revenue Minister
content: Krishna Byregowda, Revenue Minister, redressed public grievances during his visit to Hassan on Saturday

title: Former Union Minister Ashwani Kumar demands special financial package from Centre for flood-hit Punjab
content: Mr. Kumar says Union Agriculture Minister’s recent visit to Punjab to survey the devastation caused by the unprecedented floods should be followed by immediate relief to the farmers and the affected people in distress

title: In Edamalakkudy, the sick are denied treatment by poor roads
content: An elderly woman had to be carried on a stretcher for 10 km through dense forest to the hospital. Tribespeople point out that the lack of proper roads has already claimed two lives in the recent past

title: No seat-sharing talks in NDA yet, but Nitish declares first candidate for Bihar polls
content: Union Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi said that after the election of the Vice-President, NDA leaders will meet in Delhi over seat-sharing for the Bihar polls

title: Karnataka’s infant mortality rate falls by one point: SRS 2023
content: A matter of concern is that rural areas continue to report a higher number of infant deaths compared to urban areas.

title: Ganesh immersion processions turns into a divine encounter for millions
content: On the streets ringing the historic Hussainsagar Lake, where most of the processions converged, there was an air of festive carnival with people dressed up for the occasion

title: Papaya farmers told not to sell produce below ₹8 a kg in Annamayya district
content: Collector inspects papaya plantations in Chitvel and Penagalur mandals, and interacts with farmers, taking a note of their grievances about falling prices

title: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy lays foundation stone for ₹5 crore bus stand in Aland
content: Ramalinga Reddy said that the proposal for the recruitment of 2,736 transport staff was sent to the Finance Department for approval

title: Melo, Howard, Moore, Bird join hoops Hall of Fame
content: Carmelo Anthony, Dwight Howard, Sue Bird, Maya Moore and Sylvia Fowles were inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame on Saturday.

title: Sources: Lions give WR Williams $83M extension
content: Detroit Lions wide receiver Jameson Williams agreed on a three-year extension worth up to $83 million, sources told ESPN on Saturday.

title: 'Fearless' Mateer's risks pay off as OU tops U-M
content: Quarterback John Mateer's playmaking ability made the difference in Saturday's 24-13 win over Michigan, which marked the Sooners' third win over a top-15 opponent under head coach Brent Venables.

title: Belichick wins 1st at UNC, confirms Patriots ban
content: Bill Belichick picked up win No. 1 at North Carolina as it beat Charlotte 20-3. He also confirmed that Patriots scouts have been banned from the UNC facility, saying, "It's obvious I'm not welcome at their facility, so they're not welcome at ours."

title: O's 1 out from being no-hit, score 4 to stun L.A.
content: Down by three and one out from being no-hit, the Orioles stormed back for four runs to defeat the Dodgers 4-3 in a frantic ninth-inning comeback.

title: Ducks dominate after Gundy 'pours gas on fire'
content: After Mike Gundy poured "gasoline on the fire" with his jabs at Oregon's budget, the Ducks proceeded to beat Oklahoma State 69-3 on Saturday.

title: UF 'not good enough,' says Napier after USF upset
content: Florida coach Billy Napier said his team's performance was just "not good enough" after 18.5-point underdog South Florida stunned the Gators 18-16 on Saturday.

title: 'It was time': No. 3 QB Staub stars in Colorado win
content: Redshirt sophomore Ryan Staub, Colorado's No. 3 quarterback, made a strong impression on head coach Deion Sanders, throwing for two touchdowns in a 31-7 win over Delaware.

title: 🏈 The Playbook: Week 1 fantasy football guide
content: Mike Clay's Playbook now includes Shadow Reports, providing an all-encompassing look at Week 1's matchups to exploit and avoid in fantasy.

title: The SEC brought some unexpected surprises to Week 2
content: Florida and Mississippi State both produced stunning results on an otherwise relatively predictable Saturday.

title: After a cruelly disappointing year, Aryna Sabalenka proves why she's No. 1
content: Top-ranked Sabalenka lost twice in a major final earlier in the year. But at the US Open, she finally won another Grand Slam title.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Seven potential difference-makers for Week 1
content: Liz Loza lays out the facts that affect her Week 1 fantasy football feelings on Baker Mayfield and others.

title: Last-minute Week 1 intel from NFL experts: Why the Lions could win, plus surprises and fantasy sleepers
content: Could Jahmyr Gibbs have a huge receiving game? Will the Bengals finally win in Week 1? Which two Jaguars should you add in your fantasy leagues?

title: Experts' picks: Who will win the US Open men's title?
content: Sinner and Alcaraz will face off yet again in the US Open final Sunday. Our experts weigh in on how each can win.

title: Bills' 2022 draft class intends to make its mark as a new core in Buffalo.
content: A new core group rallies around QB Josh Allen as Buffalo seeks to continue its success for years to come.

title: 30 years later, remembering Ripken's record-setting streak
content: Thirty years after the epic night Cal Ripken set his Ironman streak, he and others remember the magic.

title: Who's next? Tiering Hall of Fame chances for 50 active NBA stars
content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

title: Will Fever make playoffs? Can Liberty still host? Breaking down the WNBA playoff picture
content: Six teams have clinched WNBA playoff bids, but seeding and the last two berths still need to be determined.

title: ↔️ Inside the Micah Parsons trade
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: 🤯 CFB overreactions: Belichick, Arch, more
content: What happened to Arch Manning? And Clemson?? And Alabama??? We jump to some way-too-early conclusions.

title: ⚾ Passan's early MLB free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: 🏀 Report: Clips skirted cap with Kawhi payment
content: The Clippers reportedly have been accused of circumventing the NBA's salary cap by paying $28 million to Kawhi Leonard for a "no-show job."

title: 💰 Gundy, Lanning trade barbs over Ducks' budget
content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy and Oregon's Dan Lanning traded barbs Monday after Gundy called attention to the Ducks' sizable budget.

title: 🏀 Caitlin Clark to miss rest of Fever season
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark, who has been limited to 13 games because of injuries and hasn't played since July 15, will miss the remainder of the WNBA season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Could Man United go back in for Emi Martínez?
content: Emiliano Martínez's Aston Villa future remains uncertain after his failed move to Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 10 of the top women's transfers: Yohannes, Thompson, Clinton, more
content: The women's summer transfer window broke records and had some incredible moves. What were some of the best?

title: James Madison's icy white look headlines best Week 2 college football uniforms
content: James Madison will look to make a statement on the road against Louisville wearing a slick all-white look.

title: Travis Kelce talks engagement to Taylor Swift in Brazil
content: The Chiefs tight end kept things lighthearted about his relationship and engagement to the superstar singer/songwriter.

title: From No. 1 to ... the Rockies, again: Ranking all 30 MLB cores
content: Dodgers or Mariners? Mets or Phillies? We rank the clubs with the most star power under control through 2027.

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .
